intro: Desmos monogynus, commonly known as the single-stamen desmos, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. Its most distinctive feature is the single stamen in each flower, which is a unique adaptation. Desmos monogynus typically grows in wet, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
